seller_description: The OnePlus Bullets Wireless Z2 offers exceptional performance with a quick 10-minute charge providing up to 20 hours of immersive audio playback and a flagship-level battery life of up to 30 hours on a single charge. Equipped with a large 12.4mm bass driver, it delivers deep, powerful bass and rich audio detail across all frequencies, enhanced by a titanium-coated dome. Anti-distortion audio technology, combined with a larger sound cavity and advanced algorithms, ensures smooth, distortion-free sound. Designed to withstand various conditions, its IP55-rated water and sweat-resistant build makes it all-weather ready. Featuring model E305a, it includes call control functionality and delivers reliable performance for extended use.
review: I have got the defective product the wires were broke
expected-output: In examining the seller’s description of the OnePlus Bullets Wireless Z2—a product touted for its robust battery life, fast charging, durable construction (including IP55 water- and sweat-resistance), and advanced audio features—there is a clear discrepancy with the buyer’s experience. The buyer specifically reports receiving a defective unit with broken wires, indicating a failure of the physical product rather than a mere misunderstanding of its advertised capabilities. This suggests that the issue lies in the product’s condition upon delivery, which contrasts sharply with the seller’s emphasis on durability and reliability. From a neutral standpoint, the buyer’s dissatisfaction stems directly from a fault in the item itself, rather than an incorrect expectation or personal preference, implying that the seller is at fault for delivering a damaged or non-functional product.
label: 0:Here seller is at fault
